review.room_type: PhÃ²ng 3 NgÆ°á»i NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
review.comment_positive:
1. Staff/Services: Really friendly, attentive, helpful
2. Facilities: Basic and essential needs are met, boutique hotel 
3. Cleanliness: Rooms and common areas are clean 
4. Comfort: Common areas and room are not spacious but comfortable and enough for stay. My sister and my mum three of us share a triple room, it might be too tight for big size room mates xD. Beds are comfortable 
5. $$: Great value! Got a lot more than we paid. 
6. Location: Our room has direct seaview. Hotel located at centre of main town, free Vinbus bus stop (free bus rides to most of the attractions) is just 2 mins walk which is really convenient for us!
Though the hotel is not is quiet because it is not directly at the main road :)

review.comment_positive:
The hotel is just up the hill from the FREE airport bus stop so very easy to get to even with luggage. It is on a road with no traffic so very quiet. A/C works and is not to noise. Beds are way softer than other places we have stayed in Vietnam. Has a fridge that works even without the key in the slot unlike other places. It is in walking distance to places to eat and rent a scooter
For us it was a great place to stay as we took a scooter each day to explore. We felt that it was good value for our money. We used it as a base for sleeping and suggest that you take a room facing the front as it has more windows. 
The lady that runs the place  does not speak English but is very good with Google Translate. She also did washing for us. I rate the place a 10 for Asia as it ticket all boxes.

review.comment_negative:
I am absolutely dissatisfied with my visit. I can't understand how the previous speakers could speak positively about the hotel and the service.
It all started with me ordering a hotel shuttle to the airport. the manager confirmed everything to me and also wanted my flight number etc.. But when I got there, my pick-up service was not there. I wrote several messages to the hotel and they assured me that someone was there. Yes, the only question was where? After 20 minutes of waiting, a man came with my name badge. It turned out that he had simply parked in the car park 5 minutes away and stayed there. How am I supposed to know where he is when I am assured that the man is waiting at the airport exit? The taxi was also far too overpriced. The taxi driver and the manager of the hotel were in constant contact during the journey until I arrived at the hotel. He was waiting for us there. But instead of an apology or a friendly hello, he just replied: "you Pay now Taxi driver".And the same when it came to paying for the hotel.He didn't tell me where to find breakfast or the pool.The rooms themselves were nice and clean.Even day I went to reception, it was almost always unmanned.I couldn't even ask for recomms.The manager's wife or mum was on the phone very late every evening around 9pm-2pm with a loudspeaker outside my room door, same early in the morning.No consideration for the guests.And the pool?It's a small paddling pool that doesn't even offer any seating or lounging options.But my departure was the icing on the cake.The woman realised I was checking out and ran after me.My Grab taxi was already waiting patiently outside, but she got her translator out first.She gave me two cans of Coke.when she handed me the Cokes, she Said that I should please give her 10 stars on booking.Don't make me laugh.Itâ€™s one thing, the manager doesn't speak English.But the other is to behave in such an incompetent way.

review.comment_positive:
Giving this hotel a 10 based on value for money! Honestly such a nice little place to stay in Phu Quoc. About 10 minutes walk to the night markets etc, 10 minutes the other way to some lovely restaurants. Bus stop at the end of the street for the free VinWonders bus which takes you to a few different places around the island.

The lady that was hosting us was so nice and friendly. She upgraded us to a better room on arrival. Room cleaned, fresh water and towels every day. There's filtered water at reception you can fill your bottle with and an ice cold fridge in the room to keep it cool! Good and quiet aircon too which. The shower in the bathroom is also great. Would highly recommend this hotel!

review.comment_positive: Great location.
review.comment_negative:
First, no one speaks English, which makes communication more limited. 
At check in, it took 4 attempts to get me the room I actually booked (the first 3 were simply smaller rooms, or without a window [although ordered sea view], and a couple contrary to the specific request I had for a room not near the elevator).
Although the location is in a relatively quiet street, the noise inside the hotel was hard to bear. Sounds of people in the corridor 1 floor below my floor sounded as if they were just outside my door, When it was for almost 30 minutes around midnight, it made it impossible to sleep. Also, there were often loud sounds of moving furniture above my head.
Breakfast was not a good experience. When I got to the dining room (which is on the 7th floor), even though it was only 8 am, the room looked messy, some of the options were already out, and it was just unpleasant (maybe it was after that noisy family passed there just before).
